faqs.question: Czy obcokrajowcy mogą kupić nieruchomość w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Yes. EU and non-EU citizens enjoy equal property purchase rights in Spain without residency requirements. British nationals, Americans, Canadians, and most international buyers proceed through standard conveyancing with appropriate legal representation. Spanish solicitors typically guide foreign buyers through regulatory requirements, tax obligations, and documentation—a straightforward process in established expat communities like Rojales.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty zakupu nieruchomości w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Beyond purchase price, expect acquisition costs approximately 8-10% total: transfer tax (6-8% depending on region), legal fees (€1,000-2,500), notary fees (€800-1,500), and registration costs (€300-600). Some costs vary by autonomous community. Professional legal guidance ensures transparent cost estimation and regulatory compliance throughout the purchase process.

faqs.question: Czy mogę uzyskać kredyt hipoteczny w Hiszpanii jako obcokrajowiec?
faqs.answer: Yes. Spanish banks and international lenders provide mortgages to foreign nationals, typically offering 70-80% loan-to-value financing. Requirements include Spanish tax identification number (NIE), proof of income, and credit assessment. Interest rates are competitive relative to international markets. Professional mortgage brokers familiar with foreign buyer requirements streamline application processes and documentation.
